generated.out: The iQOO 12 Pro is a high-end smartphone that boasts impressive specifications. It runs on Android 14 with Funtouch 14 or OriginOS 4, depending on the region, and is powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 chipset. The device features a 6.78-inch AMOLED display with a resolution of 1440 x 3200 pixels and a 144Hz refresh rate. The triple rear camera setup includes a 50-megapixel primary sensor, a 64-megapixel periscope telephoto lens, and a 50-megapixel ultra-wide-angle lens. The front-facing camera is a 16-megapixel sensor. The device comes with up to 1TB of internal storage and 16GB of RAM, and connectivity options include Wi-Fi 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac/6/7, Bluetooth 5.4, GPS, GLONASS, BDS, GALILEO, QZSS, NFC, and USB Type-C 2.0. The iQOO 12 Pro is equipped with a 5100mAh battery that supports 120W wired charging, 50W wireless charging, and 10W reverse wireless charging. The device is available in black, red, and white, with a price of approximately €650.

The Emporia Elegance has a 1100 mAh removable Li-Ion battery with a standby time of up to 300 hours and a talk time of up to 4 hours. The phone is available in black, white, and brown color options.

The device comes with 8GB of internal storage and 1GB of RAM, which can be expanded via a microSDHC card. The primary camera is an 8-megapixel sensor with LED flash, panorama, and HDR capabilities, while the secondary camera is a 2-megapixel sensor. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS, and FM radio, and the device is equipped with a 3.5mm headphone jack and a microUSB 2.0 port. The Era is dual SIM compatible and is available in black. The device is powered by a removable Li-Ion 2100 mAh battery, which provides up to 24 hours of talk time on 2G and up to 10 hours on 3G. The XOLO Era was announced in July 2015 and was released around the same time. It is now discontinued.

generated.out: The NEC e636 is a mobile phone that operates on both GSM and UMTS networks, with support for 2G bands of GSM 900/1800/1900 and 3G bands of UMTS 2100. It features a 2.2-inch TFT display with a resolution of 240 x 320 pixels and a secondary external mono OLED display. The device has 32MB of internal memory, expandable via a miniSD card slot. The camera is a 2-megapixel sensor with the ability to record videos. The phonebook can store up to 500 contacts, and it supports SMS, EMS, MMS, and email messaging. The NEC e636 is equipped with a Removable Li-Ion 900 mAh battery, providing up to 270 hours of standby time and up to 4 hours of talk time. The device comes in a black color and includes features such as a WAP 2.0/xHTML browser, MP3/AAC/MP4 player, predictive text input, organizer, voice memo, and SyncML synchronization. The NEC e636 also supports Java (MIDP 2.0) and includes games that can be downloaded.

With an IP68/IP69K rating for dust and water resistance, as well as drop-to-concrete resistance from up to 1.5 meters, this device is built to withstand harsh environments. The Armor X12 runs on Android 13 (Go edition) and is powered by a Mediatek MT6761V/WAB Helio A22 chipset. It features a 5.45-inch IPS LCD display with a resolution of 720 x 1440 pixels and an aspect ratio of 18:9. The device comes with 32GB of internal storage and 3GB of RAM, expandable via a dedicated microSDXC card slot. The Armor X12 packs a 13-megapixel rear camera with PDAF and an 8-megapixel front-facing camera. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS, GLONASS, GALILEO, BDS, NFC, and a USB Type-C port. The device is fueled by a 4860mAh non-removable battery. The Armor X12 is available in black, black/orange, and black/green color options.

generated.out: The Motorola Razr 40 Ultra is a cutting-edge smartphone that boasts a foldable LTPO AMOLED display with a 165Hz refresh rate and HDR10+ support. It runs on the powerful Qualcomm Snapdragon 8+ Gen 1 chipset and comes with 8GB or 12GB of RAM, as well as 256GB or 512GB of internal storage. The dual rear camera setup includes a 12MP wide-angle lens with OIS and a 13MP ultra-wide-angle lens with AF, while the front-facing camera is a 32MP shooter. The device is equipped with a 3800mAh battery that supports 30W wired and 5W wireless charging, and it features a side-mounted fingerprint sensor, accelerometer, gyro, proximity, compass, and barometer (in the USA only). The Razr 40 Ultra is available in Infinite Black, Glacier Blue, and Viva Magenta colors, and it runs on Android 13. The device's display has an infinite contrast ratio, and its camera and loudspeaker performance are both very good. The Razr 40 Ultra's endurance rating is 83 hours, and it supports various connectivity options, including Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS, GLONASS, BDS, GALILEO, QZSS, NFC, and USB Type-C.

generated.out: The Telit t250 is a mobile device that operates on GSM networks, supporting bands 900, 1800, and 1900. It features a Class 10 GPRS connection and does not support EDGE technology. The device was announced in Q1 of 2006 but was ultimately canceled. The t250 has a compact body measuring 96.5 x 49.5 x 15.4 mm and weighs 76 grams. It does not have a SIM card slot, but it does have a built-in Mini-SIM. The display is a TFT screen with 256K colors, and there is also a secondary CSTN display with 65K colors. The device can store up to 1000 contacts with photocall functionality, and it can hold up to 10 received, dialed, and missed calls in its call records. The internal memory is 7MB. The camera is a VGA resolution, and there is no video recording capability. The device does not have a loudspeaker, but it does support vibration alerts, downloadable polyphonic, MIDI, WAV, and AMR ringtones. It does not have a 3.5mm headphone jack. The device does not support Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS, or radio connectivity, but it does have a proprietary USB connection. The device includes messaging capabilities, including SMS, EMS, and MMS, as well as a WAP 2.0 browser and Java support. The battery is a removable Li-Ion battery with a capacity of 800 mAh.

The 8-megapixel main camera and 2-megapixel front-facing camera both come with useful features like LED flash, HDR, and panorama. The device runs on Android 4.4.2 (KitKat) and has 2GB of RAM, 16GB of internal storage, and a microSDHC card slot for expansion. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS, NFC, and a microUSB 2.0 port. The 3100mAh Li-Ion battery provides up to 17 hours of talk time and 504 hours of standby time. The Kyocera DuraForce is available in black and costs approximately €320.

The device features a 4.0-inch IPS LCD display with a resolution of 480 x 800 pixels and a 5MP rear camera with PDAF and LED flash. The front-facing camera is 1.3MP with AF. The Quattro V supports single or dual SIM cards, with the dual-SIM model featuring 2G bands on both SIMs. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS, NFC (absent), FM radio, and microUSB 2.0 with OTG. The device is equipped with 8GB of internal storage and 1GB of RAM, expandable via microSDHC. The Quattro V is housed in a body measuring 120.3 x 63.2 x 11.7mm and weighing 163g. The battery is a removable Li-Ion 1600mAh unit with a standby time of up to 160 hours on 2G and up to 140 hours on 3G, as well as a talk time of up to 5 hours on 2G and up to 4 hours on 3G. The Quattro V is available in black, white, and blue.

generated.out: The Energizer Hard Case G5 is a versatile smartphone that boasts an impressive range of connectivity options. With support for GSM, CDMA, HSPA, EVDO, LTE, and 5G networks, this device is future-proof and can adapt to various network technologies. It also features dual SIM capabilities, making it convenient for users who need to switch between multiple numbers. The phone's IP69 rating ensures it is dust and water-resistant, providing added durability and protection against accidental spills or drops. The 6.3-inch IPS LCD display offers a high resolution of 1080 x 2340 pixels, while the Corning Gorilla Glass 5 provides additional screen protection. The device is powered by the Mediatek MT6853 Dimensity 800U chipset, which combines an octa-core CPU with a Mali-G57 MC3 GPU for smooth and efficient performance. The triple rear camera setup includes a 48MP wide-angle lens, a 20MP standard lens, and a 13MP ultra-wide lens, while the 8MP front-facing camera is perfect for selfies and video calls. The device comes with 128GB of internal storage and 6GB of RAM, which can be expanded via a microSDXC card. The 5000mAh battery provides ample power for all-day use, and the device supports fast charging via USB Type-C. The Energizer Hard Case G5 runs on Android 11 and is available in black for around €500.

It operates on the GSM 900/1800 bands and does not support GPRS or EDGE technology. The device has a compact size of 112 x 50 x 17 mm and weighs 99 grams. It uses a Mini-SIM card and features a monochrome graphic display with dynamic font size and soft keys. The phonebook can store up to 100 contacts, and it can save 10 dialed, received, and missed calls in its call records. The Bosch 909 Dual does not have a camera, but it does have a loudspeaker and supports monophonic ringtones. It does not have WLAN, Bluetooth, or radio capabilities, but it does have a 3.5mm jack. The phone includes messaging, a clock, an alarm, and a calculator, but it does not have a browser or Java support. The battery is removable and has a capacity of 650 mAh, with a standby time of 70 hours and a talk time of 3 hours. The device is available in three colors.

generated.out: The Apple iPhone 15 boasts a 6.1-inch Super Retina XDR OLED display with a resolution of 1179 x 2556 pixels and a 91.3 cm2 screen-to-body ratio. It is powered by the Apple A16 Bionic chipset, which features a hexacore processor and a 5-core graphics unit. The device comes with 6GB of RAM and offers 128GB, 256GB, or 512GB of internal storage, all of which utilize NVMe technology. The dual-camera setup on the back consists of a 48MP wide-angle lens with a f/1.6 aperture and a 12MP ultra-wide-angle lens with a f/2.4 aperture, both of which support features such as dual-LED dual-tone flash, HDR, and Cinematic mode. The front-facing camera is a 12MP lens with a f/1.9 aperture and supports features such as HDR and Cinematic mode. The Tab P12 comes with 128GB of internal storage, which can be expanded via a dedicated microSDXC card slot. The rear camera is an 8-megapixel wide-angle lens with autofocus and an LED flash, while the front-facing camera is a 13-megapixel ultra-wide-angle lens. The Tab P12 runs on Android 13 and features a side-mounted fingerprint sensor, accelerometer, gyro, and compass as part of its sensor suite. generated.out: The Sonim XP8 is a rugged smartphone that boasts impressive durability, with IP69 dust and water resistance ratings and MIL-STD-810G certification. It runs on Android 7.0 Nougat and is powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 630 chipset with an octa-core 2.2 GHz Cortex-A53 CPU and Adreno 508 GPU. The device features a 5.0-inch IPS LCD display with a resolution of 1080 x 1920 pixels and Corning Gorilla Glass 3 protection. The XP8 comes with 4GB of RAM and 64GB of internal storage, expandable via microSDXC card. The main camera is a 12-megapixel PDAF shooter with LED flash, HDR, and panorama capabilities, while the front-facing camera is an 8-megapixel sensor. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac, dual-band, Wi-Fi Direct, Bluetooth 5.0, A2DP, EDR, LE, GPS, GLONASS, NFC, FM radio, and USB Type-C 2.0 with magnetic connector. The XP8 is available in black and costs approximately €700.

The Surface Duo features a single 11MP rear camera and uses the same camera for selfies. The device is equipped with a 3577mAh battery that supports 18W wired charging. The device comes with 16GB of internal storage and 1GB of RAM, which can be expanded via a dedicated microSDXC card slot. The primary camera is an 8-megapixel autofocus lens with LED flash, HDR, and panorama capabilities, while the front-facing camera is a 5-megapixel lens. The device is fueled by a 2300mAh Li-Ion battery. The P95 is available in Blue, Gold, and Dark Grey color options and is priced around INR 5000.

The device also features a 6000mAh battery with 65W wired charging, ensuring long-lasting power for extended gaming sessions. With IPX4 water resistance, a 2-inch OLED display on the back, and pressure-sensitive zones for gaming triggers, the Asus ROG Phone 6 Pro is a must-have for serious mobile gamers.

generated.out: The NEC N500iS is a mobile phone that was released in 2006. It operates on GSM networks and supports 2G bands, as well as GPRS and EDGE connectivity. The device measures 101 x 48 x 13.6 mm and weighs 95 grams, with a Mini-SIM card slot. The N500iS features a 1.9-inch TFT display with a resolution of 176 x 220 pixels, as well as a secondary external mono OLED display. It has a 1.3-megapixel camera that can record video, and does not have a selfie camera. The phone does not have a loudspeaker, but it does have vibration and downloadable polyphonic ringtones as alert types. It does not have a 3.5mm headphone jack. The N500iS supports WAP and iMode browsing, as well as MIDP 2.0 Java. It also has messaging capabilities, including SMS, EMS, MMS, and email. The device has a removable Li-Ion battery with a capacity of 820 mAh, providing up to 200 hours of standby time and up to 3 hours of talk time. The NEC N500iS is available in black.

generated.out: The Kyocera DuraForce Pro 2 boasts a sleek 5.0-inch IPS LCD display with a resolution of 1080 x 1920 pixels and a sapphire crystal glass protection. Powered by a Qualcomm SDM630 Snapdragon 630 chipset and 4GB RAM, this device runs on Android 8.0 (Oreo) and offers 64GB of internal storage that can be expanded via a dedicated microSDXC card slot. The dual-camera setup includes a 13MP primary camera with autofocus and an 8MP ultra-wide-angle camera with a dedicated video camera. The front-facing camera is a 5MP shooter. The device is equipped with a 3240mAh non-removable battery that supports both wired and wireless charging. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS, NFC, and USB Type-C 3.1. The device is IP68 dust/water resistant, MIL-STD-810G compliant, and features a side-mounted fingerprint sensor, accelerometer, gyro, proximity, compass, and barometer sensors. The DuraForce Pro 2 is available in black and costs approximately €400.
